author: Sam Mamudi
title: ITG Removes Bob Gasser From CEO Role as SEC Probes Dark Pool
text:
Investment Technology Group Inc. has removed Bob Gasser from the role of chief executive officer, according to a statement from the firm.
The broker said that Jarrett Lilien would become interim CEO, replacing Gasser, who had been CEO since 2006. Lilien is a member of ITG’s board and the former president and chief operating officer of E*Trade Financial Corp.
ITG revealed last week that it was facing what will probably be a record fine from the Securities and Exchange Commission for a dark-pool operator. The company said Wednesday that a market-making unit run by a subsidiary in 2010 and 2011 traded using information not available to other customers of ITG’s private stock-trading system.
Kevin Callahan, a spokesman for the SEC, declined to comment on ITG’s management changes.
